channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Massively overgrown vegetation covering footpath, 21st September
item.description:
The pavement side towards Tewkesbury has been massively overgrown with vegetation for a long time, to the extent its almost impassable on foot and brings pedestrians dangerously close to vehicles on the road. It was implied that Bovis would have had to clear it as here is the supposed entrance point to their new Coombe Hill development, but as they've broken their planning consent and moved the vehicle entrance to the side on the A4019 (with no repercussions from Tewkesbury council), this pavement now really needs some upkeep for the safety of pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 A38, Coombe Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting on 50 limit signpost a38, 16th September
item.description:
50 mph limit signpost on the a38 South of the Deerhurst traffic lights covered in tinsel stickers balloons and birdcage been like this for nearly 2 years it is distracting to drivers and should be cleaned up there was a motorcycle fatality there in April 2021 while I appreciate the need to mark the sight there is no need to leave junk all over the signpost it is distracting to drivers and could cause another accident and needs to be cleaned up ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Highfield Business Park A38, Deerhurst
Report on FixMyStreet
